name: Crispy Air Fryer Lemongrass Chicken
description: So this is what happened when I bought my first air fryer! I’d never cooked in one before so I was eager to try out some of my favourite recipes and see if the air fryer stacked up to normal deep frying. The result is really good,the chicken is crispy and golden, and there’s no need to lots of oil.
keywords: Air fryer, Chicken, Comfort food, Fried chicken, Kid-friendly, Lunch
recipeIngredient: vegetable oil or olive oil spray
2 lemongrass stalks, bruised, pale part finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: 1.For the lemongrass paste, place the lemongrass, shallots and salt in a mortar. Use a pestle to pound to a medium coarse paste. Add the ginger and pound again until a paste forms. Add the galangal and pound again. Then add the garlic and pound to form a paste (pounding after each ingredient makes it easier than adding them in all at once). Stir through the turmeric and cumin.

2.Cut the marylands in half to separate the leg from the thigh. Place in a bowl. Add the lemongrass paste and use tongs to toss to combine. Cover and place in the fridge for 2-3 hours or overnight to marinate if you have the time. Otherwise, these can be used straight away.
3.Add the cornflour to the chicken mixture and toss to combine.

4.Spray the basket of an air fryer with oil. Place the chicken in the air fryer, placing the thighs skin-side down (make sure there’s space between the pieces to allow the air to circulate). Spray with oil and cook, turning a few times and spraying with extra oil if necessary, for 25 minutes at 200°C/390°F until crisp and tender.
5.Serve the chicken with steamed rice and sweet chilli sauce.
